channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Netflix shares soar as company reports surging revenue, tops 300 million subscribers
item.description: The fourth quarter was the last for which Netflix will report quarterly paid subscriber counts.

item.title: Are the L.A. Wildfires One Catastrophe or Two? It Matters to Insurers
item.description: Some insurers may be able to collect more on their own insurance if they treat the Palisades and Eaton fires as separate events.

item.title: SK Hynix profit soars to a record high on AI boom, but shares drop on demand uncertainty
item.description: SK Hynix CFO Kim Woohyun said that the outlook for memory demand in 2025 was clouded by inventory adjustments, protective trade policies and geopoliti...

item.title: China's Latest Bid to Boost Stocks Barely Moves the Needle
item.description: Authorities’ request for state-owned insurance companies and mutual funds to invest more in stocks got a lackluster market reaction.

item.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq Futures Slip
item.description: Stock futures dipped as investors juggled the implications of Trump 2.0 with AI excitement and earnings.

item.title: Higher Yields Aren't a Scare, Bodes Well for Bigger Bond Returns
item.description: The 10-year Treasury yield was rising and AXA Investment Managers said the world isn’t walking away from bonds despite higher yields.

item.title: Abbott shares climb despite a mixed quarter. What we want to see before we buy more
item.description: Shares of Abbott Laboratories rose more than 1% in Wednesday's session.

item.title: Bank of Japan Must Weigh Trump Trade Threats as it Tightens Policy
item.description: Setting rates in Japan will become a delicate balancing act if tariffs materialize.

item.title: American Airlines shares tumble as outlook falls short
EA shares drop 7% after company lowers guidance due to weakness in soccer, other games
item.description: Electronic Arts slashed its full-year guidance on Wednesday, blaming the shortfall on underperforming games, in particular, its soccer franchise.
